For domestic inspections, a notice of inspection (e.g., Form FDA 156 48220) is issued at the time of inspection. During foreign inspections, FDA credentials are 157 presented to the top management official (or onsite designee) but FDA does not issue a notice of 158 inspection.21 With the exception of this difference and those related to pre-announcement 159 procedures described below22 inspections of foreign and domestic establishments are generally 160 the same in terms of processes and practices. 161 162 FDA has issued guidance23 relevant to the conduct of clinical studies, including guidance on 163 issues specific to studies conducted internationally.24 FDA also collaborates with certain 164 international regulatory partner agencies to conduct joint inspections, observe inspections, share 165 inspection information and develop policy.25 This collaboration is important to the BIMO 166 program. 167 168 IV.
